page.title: 06Farncombe Railway Station
page.content: Farncombe Station is a small station on the main line between Portsmouth and Waterloo.The trains are used mostly by buisness men who live in the area and work in London also it is used by people who live locally and also by children who go to school on the train. The station has two platforms linked by a footbridge. It has a waiting room, toilets, a booking office, a car park and a newsagent. For the people who work at the station there is a rest room, 6 people work at the station in shifts. Mondays are the busiest day of the week,. 7.30am - 9.30am, 5.00pm- 8.00pm. The average speed of a train is 50 mph. The fastest speed is 80-90 mph. 42 trains pass through each way every weekday.
